dt: {bc}the alcoholic fermented juice of fresh grapes used as a beverage
{bc}wine or a substitute used in Christian communion services
{bc}the alcoholic usually fermented juice of a plant product (such as a fruit) used as a beverage

et: Middle English {it}win{/it}, from Old English {it}wīn{/it}; akin to Old High German {it}wīn{/it} wine; both ultimately from Latin {it}vinum{/it} wine, perhaps of non-Indo-European origin; akin to the source of Greek {it}oinos{/it} wine
shortdef: the alcoholic fermented juice of fresh grapes used as a beverage
wine or a substitute used in Christian communion services
the alcoholic usually fermented juice of a plant product (such as a fruit) used as a beverage
a room for storing wines; also : a stock of wines

dt: {bc}a vessel or container in which wine is cooled
{bc}a usually carbonated beverage that contains a mixture of wine and fruit juice

shortdef: a vessel or container in which wine is cooled
a usually carbonated beverage that contains a mixture of wine and fruit juice

dt: {bc}a person who tastes and evaluates wine especially professionally
{bc}a small shallow vessel used to sample wine

shortdef: a person who tastes and evaluates wine especially professionally
a small shallow vessel used to sample wine

dt: {bc}to entertain (someone) at a restaurant with good food, wine, etc.

dt.t: The company {it}wined and dined{/it} the prospective clients.

shortdef: to entertain (someone) at a restaurant with good food, wine, etc.

dt: {bc}a bar that serves many different wines

shortdef: a bar that serves many different wines

dt: {bc}a list of wines that are available to be served at a restaurant

dt.t: The restaurant has an extensive {it}wine list{/it}.

shortdef: a list of wines that are available to be served at a restaurant

dt: {bc}a waiter in a restaurant who is in charge of serving wine

shortdef: a waiter in a restaurant who is in charge of serving wine

dt: {bc}an event where people can taste and compare very small samples of wine

shortdef: an event where people can taste and compare very small samples of wine
